about.title: About the Project
about.intro: The World Barometer (WB) is an open-data civic platform that monitors and visualizes prosperity indicators across countries worldwide.
about.mission.title: Our Mission
about.mission.text: To make government performance and societal progress transparent, comparable, and accessible to everyone through open data and clear visualization.
about.pillars.title: The 12 Pillars
about.pillars.text: We measure prosperity across 12 interconnected dimensions, from governance quality to housing affordability. Each pillar is scored 0–100 based on publicly available data from international organizations.
about.open.title: Open Data
about.open.text: All data comes from publicly accessible sources including the World Bank, United Nations, Freedom House, V-Dem Institute, and others. We do not collect any personal data from visitors.
about.contact.title: Contact
about.contact.text: Questions or feedback? Reach us at
methodology.title: Methodology
methodology.scoring.title: Scoring System
methodology.scoring.text: Each pillar is scored on a 0–100 scale, where 100 represents the best observed performance globally. Scores are derived from multiple sub-indicators normalized to this scale.
methodology.sources.title: Data Sources
methodology.sources.text: We aggregate data from the following international organizations and databases:
methodology.update.title: Update Frequency
methodology.update.text: Scores are updated as new data becomes available from source organizations, typically on an annual basis. The platform reflects the most recent available data.
methodology.limitations.title: Limitations
methodology.limitations.text: No single index can fully capture the complexity of national prosperity. Our scores should be viewed as approximate indicators based on available data, not definitive rankings.
impressum.title: Legal Notice
impressum.provider.name: WB World Initiative
impressum.responsible.name: Civic Data Team
impressum.liability.title: Liability for Content
impressum.liability.text: All data comes from publicly accessible sources (World Bank, Freedom House, UN, V-Dem). The platform has no political agenda.
privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.highlight: We collect NO personal data. No cookies. No tracking.
privacy.collection.title: 1. Data Collection
privacy.analytics.title: Analytics
privacy.analytics.text: We use GoatCounter for anonymous statistics:
privacy.hosting.title: 2. Hosting
privacy.hosting.text: GitHub Pages — GitHub stores server logs for max 90 days (security).
privacy.sources.title: 3. External Sources
privacy.rights.title: 4. Your Rights
privacy.rights.text: Since we collect no personal data, there is nothing to disclose, correct, or delete.
privacy.contact.title: 5. Contact
about.support.title: Support This Project
about.support.text: The World Barometer is free, open, and independent. If you find it useful, you can support its continued development.

share.home_text: World Barometer — Open data on 160 countries across 12 pillars of prosperity.

desc.satisfaction: Life satisfaction score from the World Happiness Report, measuring subjective wellbeing on a 0–10 scale.
desc.corruption: Corruption Perceptions Index ranking by Transparency International. Lower rank means less perceived corruption.
desc.rule_of_law: World Justice Project Rule of Law Index, measuring accountability, open government, and access to justice. Scale 0–1.
desc.press_freedom: Reporters Without Borders press freedom ranking. Lower rank means greater press freedom.
desc.gdp: Gross Domestic Product: total monetary value of all goods and services produced in a year.
desc.gdp_per_capita: GDP divided by total population, indicating average economic output per person.
desc.public_debt: Total government debt as a percentage of GDP. Higher values indicate greater debt burden.
desc.unemployment: Percentage of the labor force that is jobless and actively seeking employment.
desc.inflation: Annual rate of increase in consumer prices. High inflation erodes purchasing power.
desc.gni_per_capita: Gross National Income per capita: total income earned by residents, including income from abroad.
desc.trade_exports: Total value of goods and services sold to other countries, in billions USD.
desc.trade_imports: Total value of goods and services purchased from other countries, in billions USD.
desc.trade_balance: Difference between exports and imports. Positive value means trade surplus, negative means deficit.
desc.trade_openness: Exports as a percentage of GDP, indicating how integrated the economy is with world trade.
desc.rev.taxes: Government income from direct taxes (income, corporate) and indirect taxes (VAT, excise).
desc.rev.social_contributions: Payments by employers and employees toward social insurance programs (pensions, healthcare).
desc.rev.grants: Foreign aid and transfers from international organizations or other governments.
desc.rev.other: Other government revenue sources including fees, fines, and state-owned enterprise income.
desc.exp.social_protection: Spending on pensions, unemployment benefits, disability support, and social welfare programs.
desc.exp.health: Government expenditure on public healthcare, hospitals, and health programs.
desc.exp.education: Public spending on education at all levels, from primary to university.
desc.exp.defense: Military and national defense spending, including personnel, equipment, and operations.
desc.exp.infrastructure: Spending on roads, bridges, public transport, water systems, and utilities.
desc.exp.public_services: General government administration, police, courts, and public order.
desc.exp.debt_service: Interest and principal payments on government debt obligations.
desc.exp.other: Other government expenditures not classified in the above categories.
summary.country.ranked: Ranked #{0} out of {1} countries with an overall score of {2}/100.
summary.country.score_label.average: This country performs at a global average level.
summary.country.score_label.below_avg: This country performs below the global average.
summary.country.score_label.low: This country faces significant development challenges.
summary.country.regime_info: Classified as a {0} with a democracy score of {1}/10.
summary.country.econ_highlight: GDP per capita is {0}, with {1}% unemployment and {2}% inflation.
summary.world.para1: How prosperous is our world, really? The Global Prosperity Barometer tracks {0} nations across 12 pillars — from governance and innovation to health and equity — to answer that question with data, not assumptions.
summary.world.para2: The picture that emerges is one of striking contrasts. {0} nations enjoy full democracy, {1} function as flawed democracies, {2} operate under hybrid regimes, and {3} remain under authoritarian rule. {4} countries live in peace, while {5} still face conflict or instability.
summary.world.para3: The economic divide is equally telling: average GDP per capita stands at just {0}, unemployment runs at {1}%, and inflation averages {2}% — numbers that mask enormous variation from country to country.
summary.world.para4: Where does the world excel? {0} lead the global rankings. But {1} lag behind — revealing where the greatest opportunities for progress lie.
summary.world.cta: Every nation has a story. Explore the data, find your country, and see where the world stands today.
desc.global_gdp: Total GDP of all tracked countries combined, measured in current US dollars.
desc.global_gdp_capita: Average GDP per person across all tracked countries.
desc.global_inflation: Average annual consumer price increase across all tracked countries.
desc.global_unemployment: Average share of the labor force without jobs across all tracked countries.
desc.global_debt: Average government debt as a percentage of GDP across all tracked countries.
